Hello everyone!

While this isn't really something I want help with, as it certainly won't affect normal game-play, I found a way to make parts float that probably has to be fixed.

How do you do this?

Well, you start off with one or more Place-Anywhere 7 Linear RCS ports mounted anywhere on the vehicle and rotated so that they are facing "backwards:" the rear end, the one with an 'X' on it, is more than 50% visible.

Then, take the part that you want to float (a battery pack in this case), and slowly move it around on the top and sides of the RCS port, until voila! It's floating.

You can also float Linear RCS ports, and then float other things off of them! Things rapidly get somewhat strange.

Floating parts are quite stable when launched: physics doesn't really care much about the fact that they're just hanging out in mid-air.

So, any comments on what's causing this...?

Thanks for the help.

-Upsilon

Dear Everyone,

I'm going to give this thread a gentle bump, as it's reached the bottom of the page without anyone telling me what in the world is going on.

I should clarify that there's a way to use the Place/Offset/Rotate tools to make parts float, and this is not it. I think it may be glitching this setup, though: note that the "place" option is a normal white in the first picture but gray in the second.

Can someone please try this so that I know it's not just me?

Thanks for the help...

-Upsilon
